Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at the Montalembert”
Reviews.Author: Sienabene
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Montalembert many times in the last five years, for a combination of business trips and weekends. My first couple of trips were a success and until recently this would have been be my first choice of boutique hotel in Paris. I wholeheartedly recommended it to colleagues after a very good first stay. The hotel is in a very convenient St Germain location and is in a beautiful and light and airy old building. I've stayed in most room types at the hotel, from suites to the most basic rooms and the beds are very comfortable and most rooms appear to have been recently decorated in a comfortable and modern style. The suites near the top of the building are lovely. The doorman is always charming and helpful as are the staff at the bar. The receptionists are variable in their helpfulness. Last year I stayed at the Montalembert twice and was disappointed both times. In spite of booking well in advance, both rooms I was given were smokey and overlooking the noisy street outside the front of the hotel. On both occasions I asked to move room. On my most recent trip there was only one alternative room available, the smallest room on the top floor of the building. The room was the smallest I've stayed in in any hotel worldwide but I didn't mind this as much as the fact that this room too was smokey and the bedlinen smelled so strongly of cigarettes I wondered whether they had been washed. The room service menu is small and the food very bland, which is surprising in a country where it is hard to find food that isn't good. Don't stay here if you intend to eat at the hotel. An additional area that seems to have slipped is the car company that the hotel uses. On my recent trip the hotel had, as usual, arranged a car and driver for my meetings. Unfortunately the driver this time was so grumpy that he didn't acknowledge me when I greeted him when I got back into the car between meetings, nor did he bother to open the door. When it started to rain half way through the day I asked if I could take the umbrella lying on the shelf behind my seat. The driver refused to lend me the umbrella saying that "it was only a short walk to my meeting". I found this behaviour rather extraordinary, having only ever enountered delightful drivers at other hotels in Europe. Overall, I would inclined to give the Montalembert another chance because I like the rooms (if you're lucky enough to get a good one that doesn't smell of smoke) and location but I do wonder if they are letting things slip. If I have another disappointing stay I will certainly be taking the Montalembert of the company I work for's list of preferred hotels along with my own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montalembert for our wedding in Paris during the 1st week of April. While there was some construction out front the noise was never a bother and access was not restricted. The staff was top notch and helped us with several requests, they also are very quick to make up your room when your out and leave little gifts like cookies and fruit for when you return. The location is in the wonderful neighborhood of St. Germain and there is close access to the metro and buses if you need. I highly recommend the hotel and will stay again if when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: catherine w
Reviews.Content: Our 5 days in Paris were immeasurably enhanced by our choice of hotel. The Hotel Montalembert, located between the Left Bank and Blvd. St. Germain des Pres, is near elegant shops and many interesting venues, such as the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre. Our room and bath were well-appointed. The bed was quite fine. The bar and breakfast were also enjoyable. Particular praise though is reserved for the staff, who were more than helpful. Their advise was on spot, as were their recommendations. We will certainly visit HM again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel Montalembert”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinNewYork03
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Hotel Montalembert in Saint Germain des Pres, would love to book this hotel again and would highly recommend it to friends. We chose it based on the excellent location, in the heart of the charming, elegant, non-touristy Left Bank. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the Rue de Bac metro, countless memorable restaurants and cafes and an enticing mix of boutiques. Beyond great one-of-a-kind restaurants and shops, in 10 minutes you can be walking across the Seine to the spectacular gardens of the Tuileries and the Louvre. We booked a month in advance online and got a discounted book-ahead rate, meanwhile both the reservation staff and the concierge were very responsive and accommodating of special requests via email. Our room was ready early when we arrived, to our delight our Junior Suite was on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower, absolutely spectacular, especially at night when it lit up and sparkled on the hour. Our room and wash room were spacious and comfortable for two people staying a week, with plenty of closet space and thoughtful amenities like a Nespresso machine for coffee, Babyliss hair-dryer and L'Occitane toiletries. We celebrated a birthday during our stay and they welcomed us with champagne and left thoughtful extras like a mini box of chocolates when our room was made up. Our room was contemporary, elegant and comfortable, in soothing colours of beige, chocolate and deep eggplant, much like the lobby. It's worth mentioning that the bed was extremely comfortable, our room was quiet and the blackout shades made for a great night's sleep. [Other than having coffees upon arrival, we didn't eat at the hotel restaurant or order room service. It wasn't necessary with so many options in the neighborhood, including L'Atelier de Joel Robichon right next door and an excellent patisserie [Eric Kayser] on nearby Rue de Bac. Beyond the rave-worthy location and the quiet luxury of the interior space, what was truly outstanding about our stay was the staff and service. Everyone at the front desk and door was friendly, helpful, gracious and knowledgable, most especially the head concierge extraordinaire, Gilles. He was absolutely brilliant at multi-tasking, anticipating our tastes and making restaurant and sight-seeing suggestions, just the epitomy of professionalism, charm and grace under pressure. All in perfect English. Some of the outstanding restaurants we enjoyed based on his recommendations were nearby Le Restaurant on Rue des Beaux-Arts, Al Dente on Rue de Varenne, and a short cab ride away, Mon Viel Ami, one of the better options open on a Sunday night. We were very happy with our choice and would consider this an ideal home-away-from-home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely entrance, wonderful staff, and then the room.....”
Reviews.Author: Greenwich_CtLcp
Reviews.Content: While the owners have worked hard to upgrade the entrance to the hotel, the small sitting and dining area and the lounge area with a warm fireplace - it all ends when you walk into the very tired rooms. Like most boutique hotels in Paris - rooms are small - but these are quite dowdy and are in need of a major redo along with the hallways on each floor. Going in February when business is slow for them was worthwhile since the special rate included breakfast and a ride to the airport (gratis).....

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel with great location and service”
Reviews.Author: abert13
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute! The hotel's location is convenient to almost anywhere. The Musee d"Orsay is a 5 minute walk away as is the Seine. Quiet street for sleeping but just a 15 minute walk to Odeon and the Latin Quarter. Rue De Bac metro is 2 blocks away and so is St. Germain Des Pres Blvd. making it easy to get around. The hotel is clean, the service is excellent and the bathroom toiletries are L'Occitaine. So thoughtful that they even include foot cream which is great after a day of walking the streets of Paris. Had a room on the top floor which has an amazing view of the Eiffel and Les Invalides! It was fabulous watching the Eiffel sparkle from the balcony at night. Comfy beds and again they are so thoughtful as to leave you a card with the next day's forecast (in centigrade AND Fahrenheit), when they turn down the bed. Friendly staff, always helpful and they even printed out a map of directions when asked for a particular location. Room 83 is a suite with 3 balconies, a flat screen tv in the bedroom and living room. Apparently, they even have DVDs you can ask for to watch in your room, but the weather was awesome and thus evenings were spent out. Definitely look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, disappointing location”
Reviews.Author: mark_spu
Reviews.Content: The brief for a hotel in Paris was - centrally located, boutique, child (8 yr old) friendly and as good as The Covent Garden Hotel. We were recommended the Hotel Montalembert. It ticked these boxes and the staff were very friendly but it was disappointing. Whilst it is a great location, left bank - St Germain, the area had no soul (just really expensive cafes and a building site opposite), the (expensive/premium!) room was very pokey, the bath plug didn't work (let water out nearly as quickly as it went in) and the hotel didn't have any character - breakfast was like being in any cheap Travelodge. In retrospect, having walked around a fair bit of Paris that weekend, I would argue that the right bank is a better bet - Le Marais was great fun for instance. Tip - if you have to go to St Germain, eat at Le 20, rue Bellechasse - great food, well priced.

Reviews.Title: “The restaurant slowest in town and worst attitude”
Reviews.Author: NSCDC
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel except restaurant . Breakfast slowest in town. The waiters pay attention to Whom they want to. The omelette today is badly done late and badly presented, asked twice for milk for coffee and , sugar, brought no butter today , to ask for water is like you are asking a favor. Waiters have attitude as all is a favor. I stay here a week a month, they know me by name etc at hotel desk /front. By the way with over 10 stay I think have never been upgraded once eventhough they try to always have my room ready upon arrival, the front porters are very helpful, This is still not quite 5 stars hotel more like 4 Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PCapriottiMartin
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I had a wonderful time at this charming hotel. It is within walking distance to the Louvre, St. Germaine, fabulous clothing and antique shops -- in short the location is terrific. The rooms, while small, are chic and comfortable -- the bath luxurious. We stayed twice over a 10 day period while we toured around -- the second time we received an upgrade and the view was marvelous. When I go back, I will stay here. There was construction in front of the hotel, but it didn't bother us. I didn't hear any other guests while we were in our room. They arranged for taxis to the airport and attempted to help me find a lost item.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: Fantastic and chic hotel, in great location. Easy walking distance of many fabulous sights and less than 6 min walk to the Siene (left bank). Would definitely recommend and will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: VagabondoNW
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, impeccably clean, nice rooms and amenities. The service is in a class by itself, though - A+++ Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. I made a mistake in not pre-arranging a taxi for a large group and the porter went above and beyond duty to help me out. If I find myself in Paris again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marek T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was great choice - very friendly staff, great location, nice hotel with positive atmosphere. Standard room is relatively small, but very well equiped, only negative is noise insulation of doors (bathroom, corridors). Easy access by metro, walking distance from main Paris attractions, highly recommended. Overall left bank of river seems to me better choice for stay, less turistic, more local style, french atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerTom
Reviews.Content: The hotal is located in the centre, but a parking place is nearby. So when travelling in Paris, it is possible to take you own car. The hotel has very friendly reception staff, willing to help and give advice. The rooms are smallish, but that is unfortunately the standard in Paris. Rooms do have all amenities you need. Only disadvantage that rooms may be a bit noisy, and when you have a neighbour who is snoring too loud, you may wake up in the night. Overall the location is excellent. Price is ok for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NSCDC
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the hotel for business this year probably about 4/5 times. The Classic room is just the right size ( smallish but comfortable, beautifully appointed. The decor is by one if France's best decorators Christian Liaegre, shop across on rue du Bac (must visit too). Decent bathrooms, nice l'Occitane toiletries. Usually the rate includes continental breakfast. Intimate hotel, but private, friendly staff and accomodating. Good restaurant for breakfast meetings, lunch. Dinner time empty but quiet, which is nice. Lots of chic Americans from NYC , LA.... It's been now several years that this hotel has been operating, and it's still a great place to stay. Rates gave varied for classic room from 259 to 359 euros. Highly recommended if your budget allows. Great area to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMumUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the decor of the room to be tasteful, clean and chic. We would recommend this hotel for a place to stay in a great part of Paris, close to excellent restaurants and shopping. If you are sensitive to voice, request a room away from the lift, which is a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Third time was not a charm....the cracks have started to show!”
Reviews.Author: kiki7
Reviews.Content: Our third consecutive stay at the Montalembert was last year Sept 2010 and it seems the things that were good with this hotel stayed that way,other things just seem to have gotten worse. The location is perfect, the front desk staff are good, beds comfortable,restaurant food is excellent, the baggage boys (not the doormen or concierge) are hardworking, the doormen/concierge are usually neither helpful, interested or accommodating. We never got a good restaurant recommendation, directions or tips from them! The rooms need some upkeep, carpets are fraying, faucets are leaking, shower tiles are cracked, paint on walls were bubbled and peeling during our first stay....we truly hope that is taken care of. We have travelled all over Europe so room size, european prices vs. North American, hospitality standards are all well known to us. What is surprising is that this hotel continues to rest on its laurels and maintain a four star rating and rates that are high for what it offers. An example of things this hotel need to work on....restaurant reservations...never seemed to come through, suggesting tours, sites, directions... The doormen and the taxi service were ridiculous! As you may or may not know taxi rates in Paris are extremely high when compared to elsewhere...on several occasions we had to order one ahead of time and this only served give the doorman time to chat with the driver (while the meter was running) and us waiting in the lobby asking if our cab had arrived. This happened on numerous occasions, leading to our being late for the opera and making our departure stressful. The worst was when we were in the lobby on time, saw our cab, asked the doorman only for him to say it wasn't ours. We waited for ten more minutes until he got off the phone and finally told us it was indeed our cab....again with the meter running. Eventually location will not be enough to command visitors. This hotel has a great location, a supermarket across the street, walking distance to Musee D'orsay, Seine, Bon Marche, good shopping and cafes....but that doesn't say much for the hotel vs. cost. I have stayed in better three stars in my college days!

Reviews.Title: “Great people. very clean amennities”
Reviews.Author: william h
Reviews.Content: I ( from US) and three friends from China stayed in Montalembert for three nights mid of Aug. We loved the facts of great location walking distance to Louvre, peaceful and safe area where you can walk to Seine bank in early morning to take sunrise pictures without worrying about street strangers. Hotel amenities are very clean and kept neat, except the bathtub is a little less well designed to easily get out of. The true asset of the hotel is friendly and helpful staff. I experienced some internet interruption during midnight, the front desk staff was very supportive to restart the router to revive the network. Hotel manager Ms. Babara is very nice to respond my inquiries too. As a happy customer, when we were back from Rome, we decided to stay in Montalembert again. And definitely we will stay nowhere but this hotel again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit. Will definitely make it a third..”
Reviews.Author: Louise G
Reviews.Content: Great location and very comfortable hotel. A few minutes walk to the Metro, Boulevard Saint Germain, Musee D'Orsay and the Seine. Lots of cafes close by, a Monoprix supermarket/deli across the road and a Joel Robuchon restaurant next door. Very comfortable bed, but pillows definitely need an upgrade to down filling. Even managed interconnecting rooms with our children. Bathroom very nice with good supply of shampoos, etc. plus nice thick fluffy bathrobes. Breakfast not so great - very slow service and not a great selection. Cute little bar downstairs which does great cocktails and tasty little supper snacks. Friendly, helpful service throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, and Style”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelerFoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a personal vacation and could not have been happier! The location between the Musee d'Orsay and St. Germaine des Pres couldn't have been better! The neighborhood was classic Parisienne - full of great neighborhood bistros, shops, street vendors, patissierres, etc. The hotel itself was upscale, a bit of contemporary style but still classic Paris style, very warm and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and gracious. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Handsome left bank boutique hotel now resting on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: The Montalembert was my first hotel in Paris, six years ago, and I recall it as a smart, sleek hotel with interesting, modern rooms and a great location close to the Seine and the Musee d'Orsay. All those things are still true, but the cost of the hotel has skyrocketed and the attitude toward guests has become routine. My friend and I arrived in the early evening after a three-hour train ride from the south of France and needed a place for only one night, before I had to return to the U.S. Although the hotel didn't appear fully booked, we were given a miniscule room on a low floor (though I had requested a high floor), which had virtually no maneuvering space for ourselves or our luggage, a bathroom with no ventilation, and a window with a dim view into a tiny courtyard. We chose not to argue the matter because we were pressed for time. When I tried to have a boarding pass printed out later in the evening, I discovered that the hotel had no business center or public PC connected to a printer, and indeed no way to print out a boarding pass for me unless I stood with the concierge at the computer at the front desk (which still didn't quite work); by itself, this ought to disqualify the hotel for business travelers -- especially at the steep rates being charged. The hotel's staff was perfectly courteous, but the Montalembert is now a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff very friendly and helpful. Clean, good food great location”
Reviews.Author: avyi
Reviews.Content: All staff encountered were amazingly friendly and helpful. Excellent customer service . Great level of spoken English. Very clean, big rooms, great location food also good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: snider_71
Reviews.Content: My partner and I could believe how unbelievably close we were to everything. Upon arrival, even though it was late at night, we decided to take the 5 min stroll to the Louvre. (So glad that we did! The city is beautiful at night!) There were also several cafes very close which were open late into the evening. All around easy arrival, as the St Germain metro station is easily walkable and only 10 stops south on Metro line 10 from Gare du Nord. The room was small but not unexpected for the area. The furnishings were modern and the staff extremely friendly. My only complaint was the price. We paid much more than the rack rate that was posted at other area hotels. As nice as the hotel was, we'll probably opt for someplace less expensive in the St Germain area on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want an iPod dock, just provisions for tea and coffee”
Reviews.Author: Annie_Ros
Reviews.Content: I liked this boutique hotel - good location in the city (Saint Germain des Pres) easy access to the Metro (Rue du Bac), polite and pleasant staff, comfortable room and a nice (yet I thought overpriced) little restaurant. My only complaint was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Quite ironic considering that they seemed to have thought of everything else - slippers, bath robe, umbrella, DVD player, even an iPod dock apart from the usual amenities. Anyway, the location is really good. Longchamp, Pierre Hermé and Ladurée shops (among other Parisian "tourist highlights") are close by, as well as the cult cafes Les Deux Magots, Cafe de Flore and Brasserie Lipp.

Reviews.Title: “True Parisian charme”
Reviews.Author: Mucki1406
Reviews.Content: A luxury boutique hotel nestled in a sidestreet of buzzing St Germain. Lovely, comfortable if slightly small rooms ( well, mine was, I´m sure they have various categories), as it was to the back of the building, with french windows opening to a typical Paris picture of rooftops and slattered windows, so very quiet. The bathroom was well appointed if small, and the beds very comfortable indeed. Unfortunately I was here on business for just 1 night, but I would chose this hotel for a romantic weekend away in Paris, really quite charming. I did not have the opportunity to use the restaurant facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RueduBac
Reviews.Content: We had booked an apartment across the street which turned out to have a problem with the hot water. After two days of boiling the kettle to wash, we approached the Hotel Montalembert to see if they could take us in. We were accommodated immediately and for five very comfortable nights. Our room (deluxe) was comfortable, the bathroom delightful, the view of rooftops pretty - and stunning at night. Breakfasts were delicious (we had the continental) and came with charming service. The staff were very helpful - there were transport and fuel strikes during our stay that could have affected our onward journey, but we were kept informed most kindly. The welcome champagne and chocolates were well received, as was the manager's contact to ensure that we were comfortable and enjoying our stay. The location at the western end of St-Germain is wonderful - lovely little streets all around full of beautiful shops and galleries, and the proximity to the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre is terrific for art-lovers. Also good eating nearby, notably at Joel Robuchon's Atelier, but also less "famously" at Le Ferme Saint-Simon and the wonderful patisserie, Eric Kayser.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING FOOD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonniemreeves
Reviews.Content: After a long day of enjoying our week long stay in Paris and recovering (happily) from some of the finest dining experiences ever (Sensing, for example, the prior evening), my companion and I stopped at the Montalembert restaurant for a very late lunch on the patio to watch the world go by. We had no expectations of superb cuisine, as most patrons were enjoying coffee or wine.. When the wait staff brought our menus our expectations soared--beautifully planned pairings, fresh local foods, an excellent wine list, and desserts so beautiful and tasty that I would fly back in a heartbeat to dine there again. The salmon with crispy skin was the best I have ever had, bar none. A compote of coarsely mashed potatoes with pistachios took that pedestrian little tuber to a new level. The poached pear with little wings of caramelized sugar and a chocolate "squiggle" was so beautiful it was difficult to destroy it. Our waiter suggested a marvelous wine too accompany the meal--pure heaven. Four days later we dined at the Gordon Ramsay at Le Trianon in Versailles and in all honesty the latter meal was not , in my opinion of course, as enjoyable as this one..

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel but be aware: the concierge can overcharge you”
Reviews.Author: Simon7382
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The location is excellent. The rooms are OK, small, but OK for Paris. The service was excellent except for the concierge, who shamelessly overcharged me for sending my wife's cell phone that we left in the room to our next hotel in Switzerland. Without this incident I would rate the hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A New Left Bank Favorite”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyhj
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Montalembert, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice hotel on the Left Bank. We booked the jr. suite for max space, and found it to be comfortable, clean and modern. The people were great, and we were in the perfect location for exploring on foot. Amazing restaurants are within a stone's throw, too.

Reviews.Title: “too small and expensive”
Reviews.Author: goudenharynck
Reviews.Content: We booked a Standard room, not refundable.. and got a very small room which may be quite comprehensible.. The air-conditioning didn't function sufficiently. The room was too hot. Above all.. our bed was way too small..

Reviews.Title: “nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: poniponiItaly
Reviews.Content: the montalembert is in a beautiful position, in the very heart of st germain. It is not the classical luxury parisian hotel, it is more cosy, tipique, in some way simple and authenic. there is a nice mix between design and classical elements and the atmosphere is really good. The restaurant is lovely at lunchtime, particularly in the terrasse, and breakfast as well. It is a bit over-rated, I think this is the only point of weakness. I was there during the Parisian Fashion week and I noticed may guests of the international fashion system.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the worst room service on earth and not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Areca_Catechu
Reviews.Content: I was told a lot of good about the Montalembert. I like boutique hotels because it's always more exclusive and spicy. One of the appealing elements was the proximity to the restaurant L'Atelier of Joel Robuchon (right next door) and the fact that it was on the Rive Gauche which made it accessible to the nice side of Paris. The rooms are around and above EUR500/night but when you want to have a nice romantic escapade you remain ready to splash. When we arrived the receptionist was very kind and offered us an upgrade to a junior suite (always welcome especially when you don't ask for anything). It was being prepared so they offered us to wait in the lounge. We were about to go to have lunch at the Atelier so they offered us to wait with a complementary glass of champagne suggesting that upon our return our junior suite would be ready. Upon our return a clear example of oversell and under-deliver: they came with some lousy excuses for not offering the junior suite (big disappointment) but even worse was that we got a a twin as opposed to the reserved king size. Poor management. In addition, in the evening we wanted to have something light after sightseeing around Paris (after having had a great ice cream at Berthillon) and it was great to see that for a boutique hotel they had room service. We ordered to macaroni & cheese and a croque monsieur. Please, for the love of god, stop offering room service. It was stale, microwaved and still frozen. Simply disgusting and a real disappointment for a place where the bill is north of EUR1000 for two nights. Also, on of their lifts was being serviced so it kept on taking ages to get to your room or get out of the hotel. The place had nice character and the rooftop view of Paris was nice too but the above experiences make it a clear no no.

Reviews.Title: “really quite nice!”
Reviews.Author: tojopop
Reviews.Content: we came here for 4 days and the staff were terrific. we arrived early (there were 5 of us) and they made the effort to get our rooms ready and grace us with an early check in. a blessing after an all night flight from new york. we had lunch at the hotel and it was quite good. yes the rooms are small but sweet and i had everything i needed. the location is terrific and there are of course wonderful places within a block or two to get those yummy french treats. would stay here again on business or pleasure. i do vote for the free internet too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Zebdiane
Reviews.Content: We were originally due to stay for 3 days, but ended up staying 6 days due to the volcano. We loved the hotel, great staff. great location, great service, super rooms. We got upgraded so had a really fantastic room. It was expensive, but in line with all Paris hotels. Our only comment is that they could improve the breakfast fare. A better menu and more important, better ingredients (the croissants and pastries were pretty soso) would make the experience perfect. Finally, in this day and age, free Wifi internet is practically mandatory. If Starbucks can do it, surely can an expensive 5 star hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Chappells
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived the hotel answered all my questions and were very helpful two hours before we landed at Paris to book us a transfer. On arrival we were greeted by a friendly porter (it was a little late) who offered if we would like something to eat, we declined but it was a nice offer. The room (we took a suite) was on the six floor, view very nice with the top of the Eiffel Tower glimmering over the roof tops, however the room for a suite was a small and for the money we felt that it was expensive. The coffee is a nice touch but there was no tea / kettle. The TV was very basic in terms of channels (not that we wanted to watch TV whilst in Paris). The bed was huge for the room that it was in but it was comfortable with lovely curtains that blocked out the light. The bathroom was big with a nice shower. Reception staff very helpful with directions / taxis. All in all a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: cand0r
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but you find better values for money close by. The rooms are extremely (!) small and the furniture worn and it looked "cheap". It looked more like a room for a budget traveller but not anywhere close to 370 Euros per night they charged. Makes you wonder how they made it into the "Private Collection of the discerining Traveller". If it was Euro 120 or so, it would be very okay, but their prices are not warranted at all. Another thing I didnt like, there was no power outlet in the bathroom (good luck with blow drying your hair) and after taking a shower, the bathroom floor was really wet, no matter how careful you were (well, at least the bathrobes could be put to use). Continental Breakfast at Euro 24 (=bread, croissants, butter , jelly, juice and coffee) was very pricey, then again that's what you expect breakfast in an upscale hotel to be. Croissants were of a really disappointing quality. Like what you get at any middle class hotel in Germany but not what you expect a croissant to taste like in Paris, although there is a Paul bakery with delicious bakeries just 5 minuts away. Bed linens were too thick and heavy and airconditioning wasnt working well (maybe we were too stupid to figure it out, but another couple had similar issues), so the sleep the first night wasnt so great, second night with windows open it was better but I dont know if it will be noisy during the week (we stayed over the weekend) Reception was helpful, maybe a notch friendlier than at other places where I stayed in Paris. Bottom line: if you get in for no more than 150/nite it is very okay as long as you dont need any space. Otherwise, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum...Ambivalent about It.”
Reviews.Author: NYCWGV
Reviews.Content: I can't put my finger on it, but for the money there was nothing great or outstanding about this hotel. The room was adequate (but uninspired in design - standard bed, desk, and amoire, but the bathroom was tricked-out. The reception desk staff were friendly enough. Calls for room needs (extra towel etc.) were incredibly efficient and pleasant. But the energy and vibe was just dull. I wasn't looking for the Hotel Costes vibe, but something that had warmth and a welcoming feel. The location good, but not great. It's a five minute walk to Cafe Flore. And the across the street from the hotel is a full block building being completely renovated where the work lights are left on all evening. It doesn't create a problem sleeping, but just isn't the best thing to look out in the evening or morning. I think there's better hotels for the price in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Subdued elegance, steps away from world-class museums”
Reviews.Author: TheOregonTrail
Reviews.Content: THE SITUATION: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary with a trip to France and Italy. This was our second time in Paris (third time in France). We booked our room at the Montalembert with American Express points for a 3-night stay. LOCATION: The Hotel Montalembert is a cozy boutique hotel on the border of the 6th and 7th arrondissements, situated on a side street located off a busy boulevard. One of the greatest things about the Montalembert is its location on the edge of the Left Bank. It's only a short walk to the Musée d'Orsay, which is my favorite museum in Paris; the Louvre and Tuileries are just across a bridge. The immediate surroundings of the hotel include many antique shops and home furnishings showrooms. Just down the street from the hotel is the taxidermy shop Deyrolle, one of the most eccentric and Parisian shops I have ever seen. For longer sojourns, the closest Métro station is Rue du Bac; however, there is only one line that stops at this station, so transfers may be required. THE LOBBY: The small lobby has an understated contemporary treatment to let the original ornate spiral staircase and charmingly tiny elevators shine. THE ROOM: We stayed in Room No. 12, which is a "deluxe modern" room (rooms either have contemporary or traditional furniture) located roughly above the lobby on the first floor (American second floor) facing rue Montalembert. The welcome gift was a small box of four exquisite Michel Cluizel chocolates. Room was decently sized and stylish, especially the bathroom (toiletries were L'Occitane, although I'd seen Molton Brown in other promotional photos). There is a large armoire that contains the mini-fridge, safe, and smallish non-HD LCD TV. Wi-fi Internet is available for a fee, but we did not use it. There was construction across the street, but only during business hours (when we were usually out sightseeing). FOOD & SERVICE: The front desk staff speak excellent English and were very welcoming and accommodating. They arranged dinner reservations for us prior to our arrival, which I did via the hotel website's "contact us" form. On our last day in Paris, they graciously kept our bags behind the counter while we enjoyed our last afternoon before our train trip to Italy. A concierge also referred us to the nearest English bookstore (FYI: Librarie Galignani, facing the Tuileries) where we could buy an English-Italian phrasebook before we left. We didn't partake of the hotel restaurant, bar, or room service. For a delicious and inexpensive meal, there's a branch of Eric Kayser's excellent boulangeries just up the street. It became our daily ritual to buy something and take it to the Carrousel du Louvre across the Seine and people-watch while picnicking. The Montalembert is also steps away from the famed restaurant L'Atelier de Joël Robuchon, and the cafés of Saint-Germain-des-Prés are about 15 minutes walk to the east. Overall, a beautiful boutique hotel that I would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel, But Some Rooms are Really SMALL”
Reviews.Author: MBOC
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location, but the rooms are really hit and miss. Some of the rooms are just WAY too small to even fit one person...even small by European standards. Also there is much to be desired with the plumbing... All-in-all, though it's a nice hotel with an attentive staff The elevator is humorously small...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: joanne7575
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here just recently after having written a letter complaining about bad service in the bar last year. The manager offered us one free night which we accepted as part of our three night stay. They could not have been nicer to us. The room is a bit small for two people with luggage but is very nicely appointed and the bathroom is great. Perhaps our only quibble is the television which is oddly located to the side in the room where we stayed. We loved the street and the proximity to good restaurants and shops. It is perhaps a little noisy at times but overall an excellent experience and we are thinking seriously about going back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing mistakes, even more disappointing reactions”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: First, the good: this is a very attractive hotel, and we found it by looking specifically for boutique hotels in Paris. Much more up-to-date decor than most in the city, but still has some old-world charm. Most important, though, is the location. Practically on Saint-Germain, five minutes from the Musee D'Orsay (and the RER station there), a short walk to Metro stops like Rue du Bac and only a few minutes from the right bank. Also very close to lots of great little restaurants off the busy high street. Specifically I'd recommend the little bistrot on L'Universite, just east of Rue du Bac, and a few places on Verneuil (two streets north) just west of Rue du Bac, most especially Cafe Des Lettres...fantastic back patio. The bad, but probably unavoidable: our room was very small. It is Paris, however, so I expected small, and they're at least smart about how they optimize shelf space, but still...small. There's also a great deal of noise from the street, including the construction site across Montalembert, so if you actually want to keep your window open at all, ask for a room off the street. The view will suck, probably, but you'll have fresh air and a good night's sleep. The bad, and inexcusable: when I booked my room online months ago I specifically asked for a non-smoking room, as I abhor the smell of cigarette smoke. When we got to our room, it was clearly a smoking room...the smell was so overpowering that my eyes watered if I closed the window. Granted, I'm sensitive to smoke, but clearly whoever had been in this room the day before had been smoking. I went downstairs to ask if I could be moved to a different room and the lady at the front desk, Anne, said they were full but she'd see what she could do. She called us a few minutes later and said she could move us up two more floors to a non-smoking room, and someone came for our bags. They let us in the new room and we set our things down. Suddenly, it dawned on us...someone else's things were already here. They'd let us in to SOMEONE ELSE'S ROOM. And it wasn't just that their bags had been placed there...their clothes were unpacked, their complimentary chocolates were opened, they'd used the washroom. We rushed out of there, horrified that the hotel would actually give a key to someone that easily without checking the room status first, making a mental note to religiously use the safe in whatever room we ended up in lest the front desk give out another key to our room. We went back downstairs and explained this. Anne was very apologetic for the whole incident, but told us there was no other option for a non-smoking room and we'd have to spend the night in our original room. She said she'd move us the next day, so we spent that entire day and night with the windows wide open. I'm pretty sure that by any measure this was a major screw-up on the hotel's part, but the next day when they moved us to a non-smoking room we were pretty disappointed. Not only did they not upgrade us -- pretty standard practice for any other hotel I've been which messed up to this degree -- they DOWNgraded us to a smaller room one floor lower, where we got to inhale all the cigarette smoke from people standing outside the front door. Brilliant. At this point we were just too tired to fight anymore. We shook our heads, unpacked and swore never to return. Really, all the hotel had to do to repair things was make a small gesture: move us to a slightly larger room, or comp us a drink at the bar, or waive the 13 Euro fee for the one hour of wi-fi I used...anything. But they never did. We got excited when a bottle of champagne showed up out of the blue, thinking it was an apology, but then we saw the cart delivering champagne to several rooms...it was just standard practice. Even the bar was disappointing...it took us 45 minutes to get a second drink even with only three occupied tables. A few employees, especially Anne, seemed to be trying hard to make up for the terrible start to our stay, but for the most part we felt like second-class citizens during our stay. Really, really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: verona05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary in Paris, and we stayed at Hotel Montelambert. It was perfect in every way. The location is unmatched. You are in short walking distance to all of the major sights, but the hotel itself is tucked away in a quiet side street, returning to the hotel each evening was a welcome relief. The bed is very comfortable. I have to agree with the other reviews, the staff at the hotel are amazing. They are very friendly and go out of their way to make sure you comfortable. I had requested reservations for a restaurant that a friend recommended...even though I knew the whereabouts, as I left the hotel, the concierge had printed a map for walking instructions just in case I needed them. I felt the rooms were just the right size. I have been to Paris 5 times and these rooms are actually larger than most of the previous rooms I had stayed in. We love Saint Germain Des Pres, and cant wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, superior service, great restaurant, small problems”
Reviews.Author: keithburzon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Montalembert for seven nights. The location was perfect for walking to Notre Dame, the Musee d'Orsay, the Latin Quarter, and crossing over to the Right Bank. The staff at the desk and the chambermaids were very attentive. The room's furnishings were basic but nice, the bed was very comfortable. The bathtub drain was clogged the entire time we were there, but we never brought it to the attention of management. We heard some noise from the hallway, but it was minimal. The view from our room was not great, it was an old, empty courtyard, but we somehow found it appropriate. The hotel's restaurant serves magnificent food, the presentations are works of art. We felt as if we were heading home at the end of each day. This hotel is not opulent - which we preferred - but it is in a great part of Paris, the staff is terrific, and the small problems we encountered were easily overlooked. We would stay there again, without doubt. We came to treasure our room after a long day of walking and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish cosy boutique hotel with a warm ambience, great choice!”
Reviews.Author: DoviBcn
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor....so cool! Great furniture and lighting and lovely bar area with a fireplace. About the staff, what else to say that all of them are great and very efficient. During all the stay, they do their best to offer the best hotel experience. They're very friendly and smily and this is very appreciable. Our room was clean and stylish, perhaps a little on the snug side with no drawers for storage but we were offered a bigger room if we wanted to change the next day but once we got settled we didn't want to move! Cool touches in the room included an i-pod dock, espresso machine, LCD TV's in the bedroom and a specially so smooth bathrobe! Sometimes could hear other people in their rooms but that didn't cause too much trouble. Also within walking distance is some of the best shopping in Paris. Countless boutiques for shoes, sportswear, bags, jewellery, paper, etc are all over the place. Le Bon Marche, a beautiful department store, is about a 15 minute walk (full of delicatessen & gourmet specialties) There is also a La Maison du Chocolat near Le Bon Marche where I bought truffles and other chocolates that were superb. The hotel "arrival gift" was a box of cookies called 'macarons' from Laduree and they were unbelievable. I would never have known about them if I hadn't stayed at the Montalembert. There is a Laduree in St Germain des Pres and one on the Champs. I was also within walking distance of the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, The Musee D'Orsay and the L'Orangerie. With the Metro right there, you can get anywhere quite quickly. Overall a great place to stay in a nice quiet area of Paris (St Germain quarter)!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel - the service is poor and one waiter treated us appaulingly”
Reviews.Author: Coxon
Reviews.Content: We expected to find a quality boutique hotel with good service. Unfortunately what we found was a pretentious, souless hotel which values style over substance and has delusions of grandeur. The service at the hotel was poor. We had booked a table in the hotel's restaurant for a late dinner at 10:15pm after our arrival on the Eurostar on the Friday evening, and had been told by the hotel that this was fine as service finished at 10:30pm. However, on attempting to check-in at the hotel at 9:50pm, we were asked to go straight to the restaurant, rather than checking in and going up to our room to freshen up, as the restaurant staff were waiting to close up. When we walked into the restaurant and bar there was not a person in sight and we were seated at a table in the middle of the empty restaurant. The menu we were given is what we would expect of a room service menu, with the choice of main course consisting of three salads, gazpapacho and a club sandwich. We wouldn't pay 22 euros for a club sandwich or 29 euros for a salad in a nice restaurant in London, never mind in a deserted restaurant in a back street in Paris. Having ascertained that there was nothing we wanted to eat on the limited menu we were given, we decided to leave and go in search of a local restaurant serving regional food. We found many restaurants nearby which were still buzzing at 10.30pm on a Friday night and welcome of our custom. Our room was extremely small and the decor was starting to look tired and tatty. There was very little storage space and there were only two coathangers in the wardrobe. When we asked at reception if we could possibly have any more coathangers we were told that we could not. The room was quite dark and there were no coffee making facilities which would have been nice. We also found a large bug in the bathroom which was quite off-putting! Breakfasts at the hotel were ok, although the tea was as weak as water and the coffee was far too strong, even for French coffee! When we checked out of the hotel on the Sunday morning, we asked if we could leave our bags for the day and collect them before our departure at 7pm. We were told this was fine and the concierge put them to the left of the reception desk in the main lobby and in full view of the hotel's main (glass) door. When we returned to pick them up 7 hours later they were still in the same place, which gave us concerns about the hotel's policy on luggage security. The thing that put us off most about the hotel was the treatment we received from a member of staff on the Sunday as we were leaving. We arrived back at the hotel at around 6pm and, as we had booked a taxi to take us to the station at 7pm, we sat on the terrace at the front of the hotel and had a couple of drinks (we paid 40 euros for four small glasses of wine). At between 6.45 and 6.50pm, the taxi arrived and the waiter came to tell us. We explained that we had booked the taxi for 7pm and would be ready to leave then. When we got into the taxi at 7pm, we noticed that the meter was already at 9.90 euros and we asked the driver to reset it as we had not asked him to arrive 10-15 minutes early and would not be paying for this time. The driver refused, saying that a booking for a certain time means that the customer has to pay for the taxi to be kept free in the 15 minutes before that. At this point the waiter came back and when we explained our problem to him, the waiter said that this is the case with all taxis in Paris (and that taxi drivers in London are kind, which we know not to be the case!). The waiter said that whenever you book or hail a taxi in Paris it will always have a certain amount on the meter and that around 10 euros is usual. We knew this to be untrue as we had got a taxi from the station to the hotel which only had 2.20 euros on the meter when we got in it. As the waiter was telling us this story, we took our bags out of the boot and saw another taxi dropping somebody off down the road. As I started to walk towards the taxi, the waiter ran ahead of me and, after saying something to the driver, said to me "see, he has 13 euros on his meter, it is perfectly usual". At this point, we were so disgusted with the waiter's and the taxi driver's behaviour that we started to walk off. The waiter shouted after us that we wouldn't be able to find another taxi with less money on the meter. Needless to say, we walked around the corner and within a couple of minutes had hailed a taxi from the same taxi company as the one we had booked with only 2.20 euros on the meter. We got all the way to the Gare du Nord and left the driver a tip for a total of 10 euros, which is what the driver of the booked taxi wanted before we had even set off. We found the fact that the waiter had told us things that we knew to be untrue and had sided with the taxi driver rather than his paying guests appauling and completely unexcusable. Who knows, maybe he gets a cut of the driver's fares! We felt that he had tried to con us because we were tourists and we are disgusted at the fact that he thought he could get away with it. We have been to Paris several times and we knew that what he was saying was not true. Moreover, the altercation cannot be explained by there being a language barrier as my fiance, who was trying to reason with the waiter, is fluent in French. We have stayed in many hotels across the world which have been both more and less expensive than this one and have never been subject to such appauling treatment by a member of staff. That, together with the other things which niggled at us during our stay, has prompted us to write this review and to urge you not to make the same mistake we did and book with this hotel. It clearly thinks it is something better than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_J_nearToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early August 2009. Hotel room was larger than most, and most modern in decoration, a nice change. Bed ( a queen--a rareity on the left bank) was very comfortable. Very good hotel hotel for the price. Loaction was very good--just off of St. Germain and 3 blocks from the River and Musee D'Orsay.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Good Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tbs3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during our trip to Paris. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 2nd floor that faced the construction in the building across the street. (The noise in our room did not seem to be an issue, and we slept in most mornings until 10:30) The room itself is pretty bare bones/minimalist, but the bed/linens were extremely comfortable. Most hotels located in the left bank are known to be small, so if you know that going in, you will not be disappointed on the size of the room. We knew we wanted to stay in that area and were willing to compromise on that point. That said, the room was definitely not cramped, and I felt we had ample room to move around and get ready. I know some people noted problems with the air conditioning, but we did not have any complaints (and we are people who sleep with the air conditioning on every night, even in the dead of winter in NYC). I found that the service at the hotel to be quite good. Anything that we mentioned to the concierge downstairs was taken care of immediately on our first ask. For example, I mentioned a light bulb had gone out in one of the lamps before leaving for dinner, and it was changed by the time we returned. If we asked for extra towels they were brought to us immediately. Also, thought the turn down service was quite good. Continental breakfast was included in our package, and they delivered it every morning to our room at no extra charge. It was quite nice not to have to rush to get ready to make it downstairs by 10:30am when breakfast ended. The bathroom was clean and all marble, very nice. Only one sink, but we had plenty of room for toiletries on the shelves. The only part that was not great was the shower. It was clean, and fine, but a little bit narrow, and it had practically no door which ended up with a lot of water on the floor. But we found if we just added an extra towel on the floor, it wasn't really an issue. Also, had good products (L'Occtaine). The best part of the hotel is the location. You are a five to ten minute walk to just about everything, and the metro is just a block away. Although we enjoyed our stay and had no complaints, I would want to be very clear to whomever I was recommending this hotel to, as I don't believe it is for everyone. You need to understand that you are paying for your location and if you are looking for a grand lobby, plush, luxuriously decorated rooms with Parisian charm, this is not the hotel for you. But If location if your priority, this is a great place to stay. It’s clean, with very comfortable beds, with a staff that is extremely friendly and helpful, and while I would not say its cheap, it won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, great location, nice service, clean - but annoying bathroom”
Reviews.Author: SGNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I left the kids and took a romantic 4 day trip to Paris. All of the reviews here have been very accurate. The hotel is picturesque, maybe a little more modern than I had envisioned, but had nice furnishings and an adorable elevator. Room size: We stayed in a "deluxe" room on the 6th floor, which was plenty big enough. I actually liked the two beds pushed together. We had a little balcony and were actually able to see Bastille Day fireworks at the Eiffel Tower. Service: Well, if we wanted ice, we had to go downstairs, and there were no irons. But service was attentive. Particularly at the front desk. Also, turndown service, which I love. Only bummers: The building across the street - and this means the *entire* facing block - is under construction. Noise started at about 8:30 am, which was no big deal, since we wanted to get up and see the sights. But it was unsightly. And the bathrooms - totally annoying! The shower has only a little half-glass panel so when we took a shower the water went all over the bathroom. So we would have to use the few towels we had to mop up the water. But, this was not a deal-breaker. Continental breakfast was included in our rate. The restaurant was a great place to regroup in the morning. The bread and pastry was, as we had hoped, delicious! We enjoyed the hotel and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Maqnifique!”
Reviews.Author: CultureCraver
Reviews.Content: Very professional and willing staff. Not sure if that was because they enjoyed hearing my appalling french. My best experience of french service by far. Rooms are decadent kitted out with comfy blankets, thick carpets and a fully mirrored bathroom. Also has air-con, and Internet access for those that can't stay offline. Breakfast was fine, but you can find better deals outside. Ideally located to walk across to the Louvre and Champs Elysses and right across the street from a casual Pierre Gagnaire restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, modern, lovely and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: AllisonPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: We just came home from this hotel for a 3-night weekend stay and I can't say enough good things about it. We were 3 couples and all had a great experience. The staff was very kind and accomodating, many of whom spoke English and switched into it once we started a conversation in French. It's a classic French hotel, without the trouble. Very very clean, lovely chocolates and waters left with the evening turn-down services. The restaurant attached was very nice, perfectly good food and wine menu, though we used the restaurant as a morning launch pad and an evening nightcap spot for the most part. The Hotel Montalembert is on an amazingly quiet little street just off the Blvd. St. Germain, very well located. We walked to the Eiffel Tower one day, to Notre Dame later that same day, and to the Right Bank to the Seine boat tour company (Bateaux Mouches) one evening. There are literally hundreds of cafés, brassieries, restaurants, Pharmacies, shops, and famous sights nearby, including the lovely and incomparable Seine just a few blocks away. If you can't find everything that you need within walking a short distance and you cannot find everything that you wish to see within a slightly longer walking distance, (and yes, Parisian walking distance can be a bit longer, but walking is how you see the beauty of the city) than you will not like Paris. And, if you don't love Paris, you are insane.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, great location, superior relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: pspain1
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Paris with my lawyer and his fiancé and on a recommendation from a co-worker, opted to stay at the Hotel Montalembert. I had such a wonderful experience with the hotel staff and the property that I am already planning my next trip back. The concierge staff was always quick to recommend a local restaurant based on food/wine desires and were very good at getting last minute tables at impossible restaurants to get into. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to paris.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Quality”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaAnthony
Reviews.Content: This compact and boutique hotel is in a great location and served by friendly and obliging staff. Although the rooms are very small they are well designed and appointed. A great location.

Reviews.Title: “Montalembert Overrated”
Reviews.Author: chelmshold
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in this hotel. Our room, was barely big enough for the two of us. We had to maneuver from one side of the room to the other carefully. The heat did not function and the staff responded by sending a space heater to our room. I ask to move us, and they did not respond. We found the staff unfriendly and not real interested in our issues, concerns or comfort. We had breakfast in the hotel--- once. It was served with barely warm coffee and stale rolls. For roughly $75. A joke. There is no way we would stay at this hotel again. This hotel does not belong in the luxury class. Maybe a 2-3 star. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: margaret305
Reviews.Content: I had booked a deluxe room in the montalembert for my wedding anniversary. The Internet had a note saying some of the deluxe rooms had adjoining doors to other bedrooms and due to past experiences where i have stayed in hotels with adjoining doors and found these very noisy I rang the motalembert and asked to be put in a room with no adjoining door. I was assured this would not be a problem. we arrived at the hotel after 3pm and had to wait for over an hour to check in as our room wasn't ready (check in time is 3pm.) when shown to our room the room was absolutely stinking of smoke and had an adjoining door when i complained to the receptionist she sighed and rolled her eyes and told me there was nothing she could do as the hotel was fully booked and all the other guests had checked in. The front of house manager said he would send someone up to open the window (which I had already done myself ) and see if he cold move me the following day and as way of apology include a continental breakfast in our room rate. This was the least of my worries there is major building work being carried out across the street and every morning diggers etc started at 7.30am and went on all day even with earplugs there was no way you could sleep. Awful I couldn't wait to get out of the hotel each day and there was nothing that could be done because everyone else had the same problem!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique in best Paris location”
Reviews.Author: BobfromNYC
Reviews.Content: We went on a tour to Europe with my wife and got back from Paris where we had a wonderful stay at the Montalembert. It is a charming boutique hotel in Saint Germain des Pres where you have nice shops, art galleries and it is only few steps away from the Orsay and Louvre. The room is a little bit tiny, this is Paris, but the service is excellent and everyone make you feel welcome. They have a nice library with a fireplace which must be very nice in the winter. Breakfast was excellent. Great hotel at a great location if you want to see Paris like a parisian. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gavita
Reviews.Content: If you travel a lot, you know that one of the most difficult things to find is: beeing treated like home. The staff of this hotel make all the difference, always eager to help, to "solve" any complications. We had 2 problems with reservation and breakfast and they solved it in 2 minutes. The other advantage is the "location". If you are a tourist you will be in the middle of everything. 2 blocks from Louvre, 1 from D`orsay, its all near. The subway station 1 block. Rooms are a bit small, as in all europe, but nice, clean, perfect. Bed is exellent. Bathroom is great too. We definitely recomend it and will be back. *tip: if you like fashion, from september to november they said the hotel is full of fashionist (models, fashion designers, directors of magazines) and its fun.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel - Manager of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: denisemanhattan
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Montalembert because we needed a good Hotel in a central location with easy transportation access as one member of our party has reduced mobility. This was an important but short weekend family celebration trip. We were happy we chose the Hotel MOntalembert which we learned about from our Swiss cousins who stayed there many times, twenty years ago and loved it. We were glad we did. It was still chic. in fact upgraded and modernized and as has been repeatedly mentioned on this website, the location is ideal , especially if one needs to minimize walking the long corridors and steps of the Metro. The location of the Montalembert is as good as it gets in terms of location, providing easy walking to many amenities and several busses. And , as in all hotels, taxis can be called. In terms of service, our stay was especially enhanced by the charming, professional Manager, Ms. Alexandra, with whom, unfortunately, we only communicated long distance. She was on a business trip out of the country during our stay. Ms. Alexandra was the epitome of professionalism – responsive, intelligent, genuinely caring –she was not looking for anything in return other than that we enjoy our stay. She made the difference – critically giving us peace of mind before our departure as we had somewhat complicated special needs for this trip. Ms. Alexandra was good to her word. We had two deluxe rooms and were glad we did. The larger deluxe size rooms were about equivalent to our North American standards for a small room which met our needs and in addition were beautifully appointed. We especially appreciated the serene rooftop views from our fifth floor. In terms of other staff, we also especially liked the morning restaurant staff who provided “truly quality service” in the true sense of the wordswhich for means self effacing,”keeping it professional”, attentive, and pleasant. We are not charmed by insincere or pompous hotel staff who take themselves too seriously. One waitress was especially pleasant and forthcoming who didn’t seem to be doing so for the extra tip or to be one who would make “la gueule” ( discontented face) if she didn’t get one. So she did. We had a terrific family celebration in Paris, enhanced by the gift of excellence from Ms. Alexandra to whom, again, we give our thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: argv
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for over a week on our first trip to Paris. Overall, the experience was wonderful. First off, being strangers in the city, with its reputation for unfriendly Parisians, we were slightly intimidated. However, we found all the of the staff at Hotel Montalembert were delightful. They arranged dinner for us every night we didn't already have plans (including Easter Sunday), acquired taxis, and gave helpful guidance whenever it was necessary. They never once gave us any serious grief over our poorly spoken French. :) The hotel itself is clean and well looked after. The amenities are very nice and with the exception of very thin walls that allowed us to hear every word of some unfortunate neighbors partying, we found very little to complain about regarding the accommodations. The bathroom was roomy considering the size of the room, and while there was little empty floorspace to move around, the closet space was more than sufficient. The only downside we found was the inconvenient and very expensive Internet access, however we've found this to be true almost everywhere in Europe. Access was wireless, but you must physically obtain a voucher from the front desk (they will deliver it to your room). The prices were very steep! The location is convenient and just minutes from the Musee D'Orsay and the Louvre. Beware of the cafes surrounding this area... they are tourist traps. However, the hotel staff were able to guide us to restaurants filled with locals. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: buv1955
Reviews.Content: Highly delighted with the Montalembert Hotel, with a couple of things to watch out for to ensure a perfect stay. The hotel is ideally situated with The Louvre and Musee D'Orsay literally just round the corner, let alone a stonesthrow from the very chic St Germain area with its shops and restaurants. You really coudn't be better situated. The Metro station Rue Du Bac is less than 300 yards away. The staff at the hotel are exceedingly polite and helpful. Their English was great and nothing was too much trouble. We paid 305 Euros per night (room only) which is on the top side normally but not for Paris. We had a superior room (number 10) which overlooked the street at first floor level. Try not to get this room for it is over the staff entrance and very noisy at night, apart from the fact that it is a touch small for what we were expecting. We complained and were upgraded to the third floor (a delux room) and much better. The shower leeked here and the staff were informed. Both rooms were extremely comfortable and delightful. I missed the ipod dock which others commented on. The only thing that i would have liked was to be able to make a cup of tea in our room. We didn't sample the restaurant but had breakfast in the hotel on the first day. Beware at 24 Euros a head for a continental breakfast as there are literally dozens of on street cafes that can provide similar at 9 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GoranBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris. I spent a weekend in the city. I was recommended this Hotel by some friends of mine who had stayed here last year. It’s a nice boutique hotel. My room faced the front of the hotel and it was rather small but chic. The breakfast was great. One of the best things about this hotel is its staff which was very helpful. Although I could speak in English or French with the staff, two of them could speak Spanish as well. So I felt like I was at home. The hotel was very conveniently located to almost everything in Paris. I like to walk so I didn’t use any mean of transport. I like to explore the city and they printed out a personalised map for me. I appreciated it a lot. I was very happy when I saw a docking station in my room for the ipod which was a real bonus! I found my room small but this is the typical room size in many European countries. The same problem we have in Barcelona. I ate twice at the hotel and it is marvellous how they pay attention to the details. For instance they have an unbeatable menu of selected teas from all around the world. Try a green tea "au jasmin" (my favourite). Close to the fireplace reading a book... feeling like at home, great experience!!! In conclusion, the hotel was perfect for location, very clean with pleasant staff always willing to help you to have a nice stay. I enjoyed it and I will use it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We've just had a three night stay in a deluxe room at the Montalembert. It's our second stay this year. It's a lovely hotel - the decor is stylish - the beds are comfortable - nice linens - good housekeeping. The staff are all very charming. The food in the restaurant is pleasant if you're too tired to go out. The location is very good. Our only problem, & it happened for both stays, is that there was an error in the bill. This time we were charged for 3 breakfasts when they were included in the rate & for wifi when we never used it. This added up to 139 euro. A lot of money. Last time the error was also for a considerable amount. The front desk staff changed the bill immediately when we queried it - there was no fuss or unpleasantness. So I'd say stay at the Montalembert - you'll love it - just check your bill carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Montalembert.”
Reviews.Author: maudeinc
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Montalembert this August. The service was wonderful--polite and incredibley helpful. The concierge was tireless in finding us restaurants that were open (so many are closed in August). The food was delicious and we had a reasonable rate. The only thing was that the room was pretty tiny, but very comfortable none-the-less. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollandMIfamily
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, excellent location, wonderful service! The staff speaks excellent English for non-French speakers, rooms are very clean, bathrooms modern and hip (although watch out not to flood the bathroom, no shower curtains, glass enclosure doesn't keep the water from escaping onto the floor). Breakfast on the terrace was delightful and restaurant was very good, albeit expensive, but what isn't in Paris! Only downside was that wireless did not work in the room, had to come down to lobby or restaurant area to check e-mail. Rooms have in-room safe, lovely plush bathrobes and slippers, very comfortable beds. Our kids loved the miniature elevators, so quaint, views of Parisian architecture from our windows were lovely. Boulangerie (bakery), Pharmacie (drug store) cafe, metro station, bus stop within one minute walk, shopping district is only 5-10 minute walk, Orsay museum and Louvre three blocks away. If you want to really experience Paris, ditch the large pompous hotels and stay here, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied - Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: baudolino1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located on the left bank, within walking distance to Musee D'Orsay, Louvre, St. Germain de Pres, etc. The decor will fulfill the expectations of anyone with a discerning taste for good design, with a minimalist approach, but still very warm and cozy. The rooms are extremely small. They are beaautifully appointed, but very small, to the point that the TV + DVD are inside the closet and you must open the door to watch TV (refrain from opening the wardrobe door + bathroom door at the same time). The hotel provided us with a BOSE system to dock our iPod, this was a very nice touch. Breakfast is over priced for a hotel of this class (9 Euro for a small basket of bread/pastries). Service overall was impecable, friendly, and multilingual.
